Expectation1: Ensuring financial stability for the family
Situation1: The family requires money for daily living expenses, and the parent needs to provide it
Expectation2: Be friendly and polite in daily interactions
Situation2: A brief encounter in the corridor leads to a simple hello and smile.
Story: This morning, as I rushed out the door, my mind was spinning with numbers—rent, groceries, the kids’ school fees. I had to get to work early, maybe even ask for extra shifts, just to make sure we’d have enough for the week. As I hurried down the corridor, clutching my bag, I nearly bumped into Mrs. Lee from next door. She smiled warmly and said, “Good morning!” I knew she expected a friendly chat, maybe a few kind words, but my head was full of bills and worries. I felt the pressure to be polite, to not let my stress show, but all I wanted was to keep moving, to get to work and secure what my family needed. My heart pounded as I hesitated, torn between stopping to be the good neighbor and rushing off to be the responsible parent.
